subject: Travel
title: War and the Mausoleum
description: A short lesson to help you apply War and the Mausoleum.

hook.text: The Mausoleum at Halicarnassus was so grand that its name became the word for every large tomb.

buildup.text: Queen Artemisia built it for her husband Mausolus around 350 BC. It stood 148 feet tall.

discovery.text: It survived for 1,600 years, outlasting the Greek, Roman, and Byzantine empires.

twist.text: Crusader knights dismantled it in the 1400s and used its stones to build a fortress.

climax.text: Carved marble reliefs from the Mausoleum are now in the British Museum in London.

punchline.text: A wonder of the world became a castle's bricks.

quiz.question: Why is the word 'mausoleum' used for large tombs?
options: It's a Greek word for death
Named after King Mausolus's grand tomb
